snippet: Looking to mimic the likes of Roger Federer and Serena Williams, professional tennis players have adopted many similarities in their swings, with some exciting exceptions.
abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column; professional tennis players, looking to mimic the likes of Roger Federer and Serena Williams, have adopted many similarities in their swings, with some exciting exceptions; Ernests Gulbis's forehand shot, in which he outstretches his left arm high above his head, has been called the Albatross Forehand and the Karate Kid Forehand by some fans.
lead_paragraph: Looking to mimic the likes of Roger Federer and Serena Williams, professional tennis players have adopted many similarities in their swings, with some exciting exceptions.

headline.main: Odd Strokes Delight in Era of Uniformity at U.S. Open
headline.print_headline: Odd Strokes Delight in Era of Uniformity
